commit_message:
Don't update the management port when calculating delta

CalculateDelta should be used to get the list of subnets/networks to
plug (or unplug) into the amphora for the VIP and the members.
It should never reconfigure the management port.

Story 2010623
Task 47564

Change-Id: Iccae6ec561603653183911146a638272df631e92
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/41/876041/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixed an issue when adding or deleting a member, Octavia might have reconfigured the management port of the amphora by adding or removing additional subnets. Octavia no longer updates the management port during those tasks.

commit_message:
Add new DEFAULT option named "my_ipv6"

Add a new config parameter named "my_ipv6".
The default value for my_ipv6 will be the IPv6 address
of the interface used for the default gateway.

This new option is not used for now in any neutron code,
but may be used by operators to configure other options
(like local_ip, ovsdb_connection, etc.).

Requires oslo.utils version 6.2.0.

Change-Id: Icd802879e56aec00793b3683e84b16847d1c798d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/60/887960/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- other: - | Add a new config option in DEFAULT section named ``my_ipv6``. This new config option will be set by default to the local IPv6 configured to reach the default gateway. This new setting might be useful for operators that need to configure this IP in another part of their config (like OVS/local_ip) without relying on any external templating system.

subject: Include multipath_id in BDM record for iSCSI
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-23 08:21:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/volume/iscsi.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7f10f6ccb41e7f42cbbaf2dc9e8cb3d53bfad0a2', 'message': 'Include multipath_id in BDM record for iSCSI

Currently the multipath_id (which is also the SCSI WWID) is only
included in case of Fibre Channel protocol[1].
The multipath_id is also returned from the os-brick iSCSI connector[2]
so it makes sense to include it in the nova BDM record.

BEFORE
connection_info: {"driver_volume_type": "iscsi", "data":
{"target_discovered": false, ..., "device_path": "/dev/dm-5"}}

AFTER
connection_info: {"driver_volume_type": "iscsi", "data":
{"target_discovered": false, ..., "device_path": "/dev/dm-5",
"multipath_id": "3600140538f7bfe30f3e4440848e2475d"}}

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/libvirt/volume/fibrechannel.py#L58-L60
[2] https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/initiator/connectors/iscsi.py#L541-L542

Change-Id: If609980cf8f7f4e8773028544a6fec7bdee34b12
'}]
commit_message:
Include multipath_id in BDM record for iSCSI

Currently the multipath_id (which is also the SCSI WWID) is only
included in case of Fibre Channel protocol[1].
The multipath_id is also returned from the os-brick iSCSI connector[2]
so it makes sense to include it in the nova BDM record.

BEFORE
connection_info: {"driver_volume_type": "iscsi", "data":
{"target_discovered": false, ..., "device_path": "/dev/dm-5"}}

AFTER
connection_info: {"driver_volume_type": "iscsi", "data":
{"target_discovered": false, ..., "device_path": "/dev/dm-5",
"multipath_id": "3600140538f7bfe30f3e4440848e2475d"}}

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/libvirt/volume/fibrechannel.py#L58-L60
[2] https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/initiator/connectors/iscsi.py#L541-L542

Change-Id: If609980cf8f7f4e8773028544a6fec7bdee34b12

subject: Fix failed count for anti-affinity check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-06-06 08:30:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/test_server_group.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/exception.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/build_results.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2f1d65774fbcf5c25c4ba53583b6a802a03f4c4d', 'message': 'Fix failed count for anti-affinity check

The late anti-affinity check runs in the compute manager to avoid
parallel scheduling requests to invalidate the anti-affinity server
group policy. When the check fails the instance is re-scheduled.
However this failure counted as a real instance boot failure of the
compute host and can lead to de-prioritization of the compute host
in the scheduler via BuildFailureWeigher. As the late anti-affinity
check does not indicate any fault of the compute host itself it
should not be counted towards the build failure counter.
This patch adds new build results to handle this case.

Closes-Bug: #1996732
Change-Id: I2ba035c09ace20e9835d9d12a5c5bee17d616718
Signed-off-by: Yusuke Okada <okada.yusuke@fujitsu.com>
(cherry picked from commit 56d320a203a13f262a2e94e491af222032e453d3)
(cherry picked from commit 1b56714e9119ab4152e6f33985a499b2d83a491b)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix failed count for anti-affinity check

The late anti-affinity check runs in the compute manager to avoid
parallel scheduling requests to invalidate the anti-affinity server
group policy. When the check fails the instance is re-scheduled.
However this failure counted as a real instance boot failure of the
compute host and can lead to de-prioritization of the compute host
in the scheduler via BuildFailureWeigher. As the late anti-affinity
check does not indicate any fault of the compute host itself it
should not be counted towards the build failure counter.
This patch adds new build results to handle this case.

Closes-Bug: #1996732
Change-Id: I2ba035c09ace20e9835d9d12a5c5bee17d616718
Signed-off-by: Yusuke Okada <okada.yusuke@fujitsu.com>
(cherry picked from commit 56d320a203a13f262a2e94e491af222032e453d3)
(cherry picked from commit 1b56714e9119ab4152e6f33985a499b2d83a491b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/44/885344/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Instance failed by policy violation (such as affinity or anti-affinity) # and was not rescheduled. In this case, the node's failed count won't be # increased. FAILED_BY_POLICY = 'failed_by_policy' # Instance failed by policy violation (such as affinity or anti-affinity) # but was rescheduled. In this case, the node's failed count won't be # increased. RESCHEDULED_BY_POLICY = 'rescheduled_by_policy'

commit_message:
Fix typo in deploy_templates docs

There is no /v1/deploy_template; should be /v1/deploy_templates.

commit_message:
Skip flavor setter when nova is not available

... and also skip resolving flavor names for plugins if the target
service is not available.

Change-Id: I9f0ca1f0dcbcbb5a725ea1659458ddffd4a5c84c

added_lines: is_expected.to_not contain_tempest_flavor_id_setter('heat_plugin/instance_type') is_expected.to_not contain_tempest_flavor_id_setter('heat_plugin/minimal_instance_type') end context 'with heat available' do before :each do params.merge!({ :heat_available => true }) end it "sets heat flavor id using setter" do is_expected.to contain_tempest_flavor_id_setter('heat_plugin/instance_type').with( :ensure => 'present', :tempest_conf_path => '/var/lib/tempest/etc/tempest.conf', :flavor_name => 'm1.small', ) end end context 'with trove available' do before :each do params.merge!({ :trove_available => true }) end

subject: Enable Neutron by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-31 03:06:36.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/neutron-available-by-default-28ddbdfebaf981bb.yaml', 'manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/tempest_init_spec.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tempest/commit/5d06491dd6bc2b6ee98d55b971ede13b5d47e79d', 'message': 'Enable Neutron by default

The nova-network service was deleted a while ago and now neutron is
required for virtual networks. Because we enable the core services such
as nova by default, enabling neutron by default is more consistent.

Change-Id: Ic6bb2738a6e2cda4bcd66d75e16eedcb312b41a9
'}]
commit_message:
Enable Neutron by default

The nova-network service was deleted a while ago and now neutron is
required for virtual networks. Because we enable the core services such
as nova by default, enabling neutron by default is more consistent.

Change-Id: Ic6bb2738a6e2cda4bcd66d75e16eedcb312b41a9

commit_message:
Validate some parameter types

This introduces type validations to the parameter which accepts only
specific type/format, like;
 - boolean
 - a string used for resource name
 - absolute path used to create a file/directory

Change-Id: I977f9679879d1ae8b52214cd3a143f0ca523c547

deleted_lines: 'client.admin' => { 'client.bootstrap-osd' => { 'client.openstack' => { 'client.manila' => { ceph::key { 'client.radosgw.gateway': user => 'ceph', secret => 'AQD7kyJQQGoOBhAAqrPAqSopSwPrrfMMomzVdw==', cap_mon => 'allow rwx', cap_osd => 'allow rwx', inject => true, } # FIXME(Xarses) switch to param when supported in puppet-ceph class { 'ceph::profile::rgw': # swift_dropin = $swift_dropin } $password = 'secret' $auth_name = 'rgwuser' $project = 'services' $user_domain = 'default' #configure rgw to use keystone ceph::rgw::keystone { 'radosgw.gateway': rgw_keystone_url => $::openstack_integration::config::keystone_admin_uri, rgw_keystone_accepted_roles => ['admin', 'member'], rgw_keystone_admin_domain => $user_domain, rgw_keystone_admin_project => $project, rgw_keystone_admin_user => $auth_name, rgw_keystone_admin_password => $password, } if $swift_dropin { class { 'ceph::rgw::keystone::auth': password => $password, user => $auth_name, tenant => $project, roles => ['admin', 'member'], public_url => "http://${::openstack_integration::config::ip_for_url}:8080/swift/v1", admin_url => "http://${::openstack_integration::config::ip_for_url}:8080/swift/v1", internal_url => "http://${::openstack_integration::config::ip_for_url}:8080/swift/v1", } # FIXME(Xarses) remove when supported in puppet-ceph Service<| tag == 'ceph-radosgw' |> -> Service <| tag == 'glance-service' |> }

commit_message:
service_identity: Fix incomplete usage of domain parameters

This fixes the ignored project_domain parameter, and also ensures
the user_domain parameter is used when creating a role assignment.

Closes-Bug: #2029035
Change-Id: I2a2d9c648fff1b940952700b492af6a09974ee5c

commit_message:
func: Allow compute_driver to be set and used by _IntegratedTestBase

This should ease eventual migrations from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase
class, as suggested by an outstanding TODO.

Change-Id: I5a76c5d32593a9ebcd02d845eb51d70547c60460
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/84/764484/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(lyarwood): Ease migrations from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase by # optionally allowing compute_driver to be set and used if self.compute_driver: self.flags(compute_driver=self.compute_driver)

commit_message:
Add reset_encryption_fields() and save_all() to BlockDeviceMappingList

Related to blueprint ephemeral-storage-encryption

Change-Id: Iedd72c42057d7122e3086dfad2ff48e87ac08cf3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/38/870938/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def reset_encryption_fields(self): self.encrypted = False encryption_fields = [ 'encryption_secret_uuid', 'encryption_format', 'encryption_options', ] for field in encryption_fields: self[field] = None # Version 1.19: Add reset_encryption_fields() and save_all() VERSION = '1.19' def reset_encryption_fields(self): """Reset encryption fields for all BlockDeviceMappings in this list""" for obj in self.objects: obj.reset_encryption_fields() def save_all(self): """Save changes for all BlockDeviceMappings in this list""" for obj in self.objects: obj.save()

subject: proxy-server: use a prefixed shard range cache key
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-31 14:26:28.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/memcached.py', 'test/unit/__init__.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_container.py', 'test/unit/common/test_memcached.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/container.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/d84eda790eb0b64ea99349d893fba47bc2dcfaa9', 'message': "proxy-server: use a prefixed shard range cache key

mcrouter supports configurable lookup policies based on the prefix of
the memcache key. For example, a different mcrouter policy could be
configured for looking up cached shard ranges. This would require all
shard range memcache keys to have a well-known key prefix. However,
Swift's MemcacheRing client currently uses the md5 hash of the
caller's key as the memcache key e.g.:

  key = md5hash('shard-updating-v2/a/c')

There is therefore no uniform prefix for any particular category of
cache keys.

This patch therefore adds support for MemcacheRing to optionally
prefix memcache keys with the unhashed prefix of the caller's key e.g.:

  key = b'shard-updating-v2/a/' + md5hash('shard-updating-v2/a/c')

Change-Id: I476845c268445708f55fb77f3479881e11e6ef4b
"}]
commit_message:
proxy-server: use a prefixed shard range cache key

mcrouter supports configurable lookup policies based on the prefix of
the memcache key. For example, a different mcrouter policy could be
configured for looking up cached shard ranges. This would require all
shard range memcache keys to have a well-known key prefix. However,
Swift's MemcacheRing client currently uses the md5 hash of the
caller's key as the memcache key e.g.:

  key = md5hash('shard-updating-v2/a/c')

There is therefore no uniform prefix for any particular category of
cache keys.

This patch therefore adds support for MemcacheRing to optionally
prefix memcache keys with the unhashed prefix of the caller's key e.g.:

  key = b'shard-updating-v2/a/' + md5hash('shard-updating-v2/a/c')

Change-Id: I476845c268445708f55fb77f3479881e11e6ef4b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/39/890139/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def clear_info_cache(env, account, container=None, shard=None, use_prefix=False): memcache.delete(cache_key, use_prefix=use_prefix)
deleted_lines: def clear_info_cache(env, account, container=None, shard=None): memcache.delete(cache_key)

subject: [stable-only] Cap virtualenv/setuptools
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-17 15:12:49.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/4673e091fe9fcc1d6154f6430c74f8e4f56203e5', 'message': "[stable-only] Cap virtualenv/setuptools

With latest virtualenv release (20.24.0) and its bundled setuptools
version, stable/victoria gates started to fail [1], because setuptools
is not compatible with the pbr version (5.5.0) which is in victoria
branch's upper constraint [2]. pbr's next release (5.5.1) removed the
failing code, this is why the change is only needed in stable/victoria.

This patch caps virtualenv to <20.24.0 to fix stable/victoria's gate,
and also caps tox for the 'inner' virtualenv, otherwise tox>4 would be
installed, that would introduce failures (those failures are fixed in
newer stable branches, but it would need several backports and 'outer'
tox is capped <4 anyway, so no worth dealing with it here).

[1] AttributeError: module 'setuptools.command.easy_install' has no attribute 'get_script_header'
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/src/commit/636b6b3bde4b68ef27ac6b524cb888152eddf517/upper-constraints.txt#L44

Change-Id: I4c1b2829dd07ce0dd48c6ac6d56a52ecc1d83b98
"}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap virtualenv/setuptools

With latest virtualenv release (20.24.0) and its bundled setuptools
version, stable/victoria gates started to fail [1], because setuptools
is not compatible with the pbr version (5.5.0) which is in victoria
branch's upper constraint [2]. pbr's next release (5.5.1) removed the
failing code, this is why the change is only needed in stable/victoria.

This patch caps virtualenv to <20.24.0 to fix stable/victoria's gate,
and also caps tox for the 'inner' virtualenv, otherwise tox>4 would be
installed, that would introduce failures (those failures are fixed in
newer stable branches, but it would need several backports and 'outer'
tox is capped <4 anyway, so no worth dealing with it here).

[1] AttributeError: module 'setuptools.command.easy_install' has no attribute 'get_script_header'
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/src/commit/636b6b3bde4b68ef27ac6b524cb888152eddf517/upper-constraints.txt#L44

Change-Id: I4c1b2829dd07ce0dd48c6ac6d56a52ecc1d83b98
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/09/888709/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Cap setuptools via virtualenv to prevent compatibility issue with victoria # branch's upper constraint of pbr package (5.5.0). Tox is also needed to be # constrained for the 'inner' tox to be installed with the constrained venv. requires = virtualenv<20.24.0 tox<4

subject: [WIP] Wait for secure boot state change if it's not immediate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-21 08:55:27.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/redfish/management.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/3ddb12baaa457e33b71da4b1b9caa87d74a47786', 'message': "[WIP] Wait for secure boot state change if it's not immediate

Change-Id: I422c0dd7413cb25708d2bb68b58d9277b3c3ab7c
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Wait for secure boot state change if it's not immediate

Change-Id: I422c0dd7413cb25708d2bb68b58d9277b3c3ab7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/63/889163/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._wait_for_boot_mode(task, mode) LOG.info('Boot mode for node %(node)s has been set to ' '%(value)s', {'node': task.node.uuid, 'value': mode}) def _wait_for_boot_mode(self, task, mode): system = redfish_utils.get_system(task.node) # TODO(janders) # NOTE(dtantsur/janders): at least Dell machines change boot mode via # a BIOS configuration job. A reboot is needed to apply it. # TODO(janders) find out if caching may be a problem here if system.get_boot_mode == mode: return LOG.info('Rebooting node %(node)s to change boot mode to ' '%(value)s', {'node': task.node.uuid, 'value': mode}) old_power_state = task.driver.power.get_power_state(task) manager_utils.node_power_action(task, states.REBOOT) threshold = time.time() + CONF.redfish.secure_boot_config_timeout while time.time() <= threshold and system.get_boot_mode != mode: LOG.debug('Still waiting for boot mode of node %(node)s ' 'to become %(value)s, current is %(current)s', {'node': task.node.uuid, 'value': mode, 'current': system.get_boot_mode}) time.sleep(SECURE_BOOT_CONFIG_INTERVAL) if system.get_boot_mode != mode: msg = (_('Timeout reached while waiting for boot mode of ' 'node %(node)s to become %(state)s, ' 'current is %(current)s') % {'node': task.node.uuid, 'state': mode, 'current': system.get_boot_mode}) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.RedfishError(error=msg) manager_utils.node_power_action(task, old_power_state)

commit_message:
Restructure tech-preview list and remove accepted charms

Tech-preview category is removed in favor of identifying the specific
details from a support point of view.

Change-Id: I45411c5f70a931bcc984672edbd3f2bbe67e5403

added_lines: .. list-table:: :header-rows: 1 :widths: auto * - Charm - Reason for tech-preview * - `cinder-nimblestorage`_ - No Nimble appliance to test with * - `cinder-solidfire`_ - No SolidFire appliance to test with * - `ironic-api`_ - No Ubuntu based PXE images; the gate only verifies charm deployment, not functionality * - `ironic-conductor`_ - See ironic-api * - `magnum`_ - Uncertain about supportability of Magnum's process with managing Kubernetes versions * - `magnum-dashboard`_ - See magnum * - `manila-netapp`_ - Don't have a good functional testing story * - `neutron-api-plugin-ironic`_ - See ironic-api * - `nova-compute-nvidia-vgpu`_ - Don't have a good functional test in gate due to hardware requirements

commit_message:
Update timedelta and old schedules as per netapp_snapmirror_schedule

Asynchronous SnapMirror schedules are set using netapp config option
'netapp_snapmirror_schedule'. The delta for determining replica is
in-sync or out-of-sync updated to twice the schedule time seconds.
Also, not only new snapmirrors, but also old ones should
have a schedule according to the current
'netapp_snapmirror_schedule' config.

Closes-bug: #1996859
Depends-On: I0390f82dfdc130d49e3af6928996dd730e3cf69f
Change-Id: Ifbe0575f6c359929344763666e4d93d8c6084e83
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/83/866883/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | NetApp ONTAP driver updated to consider timestamp delta calculated from async schedule config option instead of hard-coded value. Delta is calculated as double the time set of the schedule. For more details refer launchpad `bug #1996859 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1996859>`_

subject: Enable liberal TCP connection tracking for SNAT namespaces
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-11-15 16:25:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3034a90592ff86e5ff95e5b8a4515bdb859dd021', 'message': 'Enable liberal TCP connection tracking for SNAT namespaces

This can avoid connections randomly hanging due to tcp window
scaling not correctly being tracked. It should not have a large
effect otherwise.

Change-Id: I5e58bb2850bfa8e974e62215af0b4d7bc0592c13
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-11-15 18:30:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2d158ee168375c633cc7926cd0b75c2392d3b5a4', 'message': 'Enable liberal TCP connection tracking for SNAT namespaces

This can avoid connections randomly hanging due to tcp window
scaling not correctly being tracked.  This prevents packets
which are considered invalid by the connection tracking
from bein thrown out and allows the underlying TCP stack
recovery to function rather than stalling permanently.

Change-Id: I5e58bb2850bfa8e974e62215af0b4d7bc0592c13
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2018-11-20 23:01:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/13f4ac25dd67a7bb2ee21a4fc8e1b9e19c418d12', 'message': 'Enable liberal TCP connection tracking for SNAT namespaces

This can avoid connections rarely hanging due to tcp window
scaling not correctly being observed by the TCP connection
tracking. this seems to happen when retransmits are occurring
occassionally.
Setting this parameter turns off validating the window scaling
checks for the purpose of matching whether a packet matches
an existing connection tracked flow, which avoids the SNAT
namespace from interfering and letting the connection peers
recover the connection via retransmits/Selective ACKs instead
of the SNAT terminating one side of the connection and letting
it stall permanently.

commit_message:
Enable liberal TCP connection tracking for SNAT namespaces

This can avoid connections rarely hanging due to tcp window
scaling not correctly being observed by the TCP connection
tracking. this seems to happen when retransmits are occurring
occassionally.
Setting this parameter turns off validating the window scaling
checks for the purpose of matching whether a packet matches
an existing connection tracked flow, which avoids the SNAT
namespace from interfering and letting the connection peers
recover the connection via retransmits/Selective ACKs instead
of the SNAT terminating one side of the connection and letting
it stall permanently.

Closes-Bug: #1804327
Change-Id: I5e58bb2850bfa8e974e62215af0b4d7bc0592c13
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/08/618208/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Be liberal in the state tracking to avoid # issues with TCP window scaling cmd = ['net.netfilter.nf_conntrack_tcp_loose=0', 'net.netfilter.nf_conntrack_tcp_be_liberal=1']

commit_message:
Improve backport policy wording and structure

Make things clearer and provide a better structure.

Change-Id: Id843784ba68fab2965781585e5f59b0f7cbfe6de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/67/889367/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stability. While users expect stability, they also expect bug fixes. The balance of providing these fixes while maintaining stability is extremely important.Anyone can propose that a fix be backported to a stable branch. Requirements ~~~~~~~~~~~~ The below requirements must be met for a backport to be accepted. * **reverse chronological order** - in order to be accepted into a given stable branch, it must be merged into all newer stable branches first, including the development branch * **cherry pick line** - it must include a "cherry picked from commit ..." line in its commit message * **backkport reasoning** - it must include a reasoning behind the backport in its commit message, explaining in particular how the request constitutes a valid backport candidate * **CI testing** - if it relies on functional testing, the tests must be backported in tandem (e.g. `Refactor unit tests to avoid leaks of mocks`_)* new behaviour is introduced in the charm * new behaviour is introduced in the payload * new Debian packages are installed on the host * new Python packages are installed in the charmCommon backport request types ----------------------------- The following sections cover common types of backport requests. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ A backport of a simple charm configuration enablement that is opt-in is a candidate to be backported. For changes to configuration options, new behaviour must not be introduced. This can take the form of default values changed in comparison to the ones already defined in the configuration template or the payload's default. Here is an example of a patch that introduced a new configuration option without changing the default behaviour: `Support --visibility option for simplestreams`_~~~~~~~~~~~~ A Juju action that improves operator experience is a candidate to be backported. For changes to actions, the stable maintainers team takes extra care to asses what risk the new action introduces. If you consider the risk to be minimal, then include your reasoning, so the maintainers team can take a more informed decision. In general, actions that execute only read operations on the system areAll charm stable branch reviews must be approved by **two** core reviewers or stable maintainers prior to landing and CI system(s) voted with a Verified+1. Cherry picking details ---------------------- Backports are done by cherry picking a patch that has been already merged into a more recent branch (e.g. ``master``). The simplest way to do this is with the `"Cherry Pick" button`_ in the web UI for the original patch (e.g. ``master``). Gerrit will automatically create a new review and include the cherry pick line in its commit message. However, you can also use `git-review`_ to manually propose a backport. For example, to propose a backport from the ``master`` branch to the ``zed`` branch: git cherry-pick -x <master_commit_id>The ``-x`` option in the :command:`cherry-pick` command inserts the cherry pick line in the commit message.
deleted_lines: stability. While users expect stability, they also expect bug fixes. The balance of providing these fixes while maintaining stability is extremely important.All backport candidates must be merged into the current development branch. Backports must be proposed in reverse chronological order. In order to accept a change into a given stable branch, it must be merged into all newer stable branches first, including the development branch. All backports must include the footer "cherry picked from commit ...".A backport of a simple configuration enablement that is opt-in is a candidate to be backported. A juju action that improves operator experience is a candidate to be backported. * New behaviour is introduced in the charm * New behaviour is introduced in the payload * New Debian packages are installed on the host * New Python packages are installed in the charm--------------------------- Its important patches dont introduce new behaviors. This can take the form of default values changed in comparison to the ones already defined in the configuration template or the payload's default. This is an example of a patch that introduced a new configuration option without changing the default behavior: `Support --visibility option for simplestreams`_------------ The stable maintainers team takes extra care to asses what risk the new action introduces, if you consider the risk to be minimal, then include your reasoning, so the maintainers team can take a more informed decision. In general actions that execute only read operations on the system areCI testing ---------- Commits that depend on functional testing need to be backported as well in tandem, for example: `Refactor unit tests to avoid leaks of mocks`_. All charm stable branch reviews must be approved by two core reviewers or stable maintainers prior to landing and CI system(s) voted with a Verified+1. Proposing Fixes --------------- Anyone can propose a fix to the stable maintainers team. The OpenStack Charms project uses git for source version control, hence backports are done by cherry picking a patch that has been already merged into another branch (e.g. ``master``). The simplest way to cherry-pick a change is to use the `"Cherry Pick" button`_ in the web UI for the original patch in ``master``. Gerrit will take care of creating a new review, modifying the commit message to include "cherry picked from commit ..." You can use `git-review`_ to propose a change to the ``zed`` branch with: git cherry-pick -x $master_commit_id.. note:: cherry-pick -x option includes 'cherry-picked from ...' line in the commit message, required by policy.

commit_message:
Replace blockdiag with graphviz

The python blockdiag module is unmaintained and will likely be removed from distros.[1]
This patch replaces blockdiag with graphviz diagrams.

[1] https://github.com/blockdiag/blockdiag/pull/171

Change-Id: I3a902c60b59071b466e1bf1ec6bda205e58b378c

commit_message:
Test ceph volume backup driver

This enables ceph volume backup driver in scenario 001 so that we can
test deployment of the driver.

Change-Id: Ia07f1be0491bb25a0e5d7b518e9c764a6281474d

commit_message:
New boundray scenario tests for a Quota test suite

1) test_zone_recordsets_boundary
   Number of recordsets allowed per zone
2) test_zone_records_boundary
   Number of records allowed per zone
3) test_recordset_records_boundary
   Number of records allowed per recordset
4) test_api_export_size_boundary
   Number of recordsets allowed in a zone export

Change-Id: Ic51be2d04427644f82452178375bb5bcf3331127
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin refs/changes/35/860935/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Create a dedicated Project for Boundary test 'zones': 1, 'zone_recordsets': 7, 'zone_records': 7, 'recordset_records': 7, 'api_export_size': 7} quota_exeded_zone = self.zone_client.create_zone( self.addCleanup( self.wait_zone_delete, self.zone_client, quota_exeded_zone['id']) quota_exceeded_zone = None try: rsp_headers, quota_exceeded_zone = self.zone_client.create_zone( if rsp_headers['status'] != 413: 'Zone', quota_exeded_zone['id'], quota_exeded_zone['status']) if quota_exceeded_zone: self.addCleanup( self.wait_zone_delete, self.zone_client, quota_exeded_zone['id'], headers=sudo_header, ignore_errors=lib_exc.NotFound) @decorators.attr(type='slow') @decorators.idempotent_id('e4981eb2-3803-11ed-9d3c-201e8823901f') @decorators.skip_because(bug="1992445") def test_zone_recordsets_boundary(self): # Create a Zone zone_name = dns_data_utils.rand_zone_name( name="test_zone_recordsets_boundary", suffix=self.tld_name) zone = self.zone_client.create_zone( name=zone_name, project_id=tenant_id)[1] self.addCleanup(self.wait_zone_delete, self.zone_client, zone['id']) # Create a 3rd recordset --> Should PASS recordset_data = dns_data_utils.rand_recordset_data( record_type='A', zone_name=zone['name']) resp, body = self.recordset_client.create_recordset( zone['id'], recordset_data, headers=sudo_header) self.addCleanup( self.wait_recordset_delete, self.recordset_client, zone['id'], body['id']) # Create a 4th recordset --> should FAIL on: 413 over_quota recordset_data = dns_data_utils.rand_recordset_data( record_type='A', zone_name=zone['name']) quota_recset_zone = None try: resp, quota_recset_zone = self.recordset_client.create_recordset( zone['id'], recordset_data, headers=sudo_header) self.wait_recordset_delete, self.recordset_client, zone['id'], quota_recset_zone['id']) if resp['status'] != 413: raise exceptions.InvalidStatusError( 'Recordset', quota_recset_zone['id'], quota_recset_zone['status']) except Exception as e: self.assertIn('over_quota', str(e), 'Failed, over_quota for a ' 'zone_recordsets was not raised') finally: if quota_recset_zone: self.addCleanup( self.wait_recordset_delete, self.recordset_client, quota_recset_zone['id'], headers=sudo_header, ignore_errors=lib_exc.NotFound) @decorators.attr(type='slow') @decorators.idempotent_id('5c948fec-47c5-11ed-ad06-201e8823901f') def test_zone_records_boundary(self): # Create a second recordset and try to export Zone --> Should FAIL recordset_data = dns_data_utils.rand_recordset_data( record_type='A', zone_name=zone['name']) recordset = self.recordset_client.create_recordset( zone['id'], recordset_data, headers=sudo_header)[1] self.addCleanup( self.wait_recordset_delete, self.recordset_client, zone['id'], recordset['id']) with self.assertRaisesDns( lib_exc.OverLimit, 'over_quota', 413): self.export_zone_client.create_zone_export( zone['id'], headers=sudo_header)

commit_message:
enforce(): Check scope against actual rule rather than just the default rule

This allows us to override scope requrements in policy.yaml; previously
it checked the default scope requirements regardless of custom policy.

This code is a bit convoluted and probably needs a refactor; as it is
we get a proper scope exception if breaking scope in a default rule
but just a generic 'unauthorized' exception if we break scope in
in a yaml-defined rule.

Fixes-bug: 2017056
Change-Id: If2eace37b942d96a3ff04614ebac1bede32bbeeb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy refs/changes/61/883861/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if rule not in self.file_rules: # No override, we're falling back on the default rules # stored in registered_rules. They support slightly more # nuanced scope checking so handle that as a special case. registered_rule = self.registered_rules.get(rule) if registered_rule and registered_rule.scope_types: scope_valid = self._enforce_scope(creds, registered_rule, do_raise=do_raise) if not scope_valid: return False
deleted_lines: registered_rule = self.registered_rules.get(rule) if registered_rule and registered_rule.scope_types: scope_valid = self._enforce_scope(creds, registered_rule, do_raise=do_raise) if not scope_valid: return False

commit_message:
Unbind port when offloading a shelved instance

When offloading a shelved instance, the compute needs to remove the
binding so the port will appear as "unbound" in neutron.

Closes-Bug: 1983471

Change-Id: Ia49271b126870c7936c84527a4c39ab96b6c5ea7
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4eef0fe6354304b4639a3b635e4955457188e4ce)

added_lines: class PortBindingShelvedServerTest(integrated_helpers._IntegratedTestBase): """Tests for servers with ports.""" compute_driver = 'fake.SmallFakeDriver' def setUp(self): super(PortBindingShelvedServerTest, self).setUp() self.flavor_id = self._create_flavor( disk=10, ephemeral=20, swap=5 * 1024) def test_shelve_offload_with_port(self): # Do not wait before offloading self.flags(shelved_offload_time=0) server = self._create_server( flavor_id=self.flavor_id, networks=[{'port': self.neutron.port_1['id']}]) port = self.neutron.show_port(self.neutron.port_1['id'])['port'] # Assert that the port is actually associated to the instance self.assertEqual(port['device_id'], server['id']) self.assertEqual(port['binding:host_id'], 'compute') self.assertEqual(port['binding:status'], 'ACTIVE') # Do shelve server = self._shelve_server(server, 'SHELVED_OFFLOADED') # Retrieve the updated port port = self.neutron.show_port(self.neutron.port_1['id'])['port'] # Assert that the port is still associated to the instance # but the binding is not on the compute anymore self.assertEqual(port['device_id'], server['id']) self.assertIsNone(port['binding:host_id']) self.assertNotIn('binding:status', port)

commit_message:
Have host look for CPU controller of cgroupsv2 location.

Make the host class look under '/sys/fs/cgroup/cgroup.controllers' for support of the cpu controller. The host will try searching through cgroupsv1 first, just like up until now, and in the case that fails, it will try cgroupsv2 then. The host will not support the feature if both checks fail.

This new check needs to be mocked by all tests that focus on this piece of code, as it touches a system file that requires privileges. For such thing, the CGroupsFixture is defined to easily add suck mocking to all test cases that require so.

I also removed old mocking at test_driver.py in favor of the fixture from above.

Partial-Bug: #2008102
Change-Id: I99b57c27c8a4425389bec2b7f05af660bab85610
(cherry picked from commit 973ff4fc1a0586937d13f2b39e517422713b1003)

commit_message:
Simplify and update-governance

The existing version does not handle projects under the "distributed" leadership model, if also badly damages projects.yaml and does unneeded, potentially error prone, work to determine the election results

Simplify the tool to address these issues

Change-Id: Icc67336742f43030d4e1743c6db691fafc250cfa

commit_message:
Very basic in-band inspection with the "agent" interface

Only port creation/updating/deletion logic has been replicated from
ironic-inspector, as well as the add_ports and keep_ports options.

In the future patches, the added code will become a part of processing
hooks.

Change-Id: I69d6a1a53c5bf9e0f41d1a5bce7215edeea54b22

commit_message:
Add a Sorting function.

Currently we're reverse sorting with a simple sort, this sadly puts
newer released (antalope, bobcat) at the end of the list.  Add a
key function that has context around our release names and release ids
to sort "2024.1/cantaloupe"[1] at the top.

[1] As of now the c name isn't selected cantaloupe is my placeholder

Change-Id: Ie7a9ffcdbe6a28cd2a80289ec06259ec869d306f

commit_message:
Horizon: Enable policy settings

This enables the horizon::policy class to test management of policy
files. Note that we enable the feature only in CentOS for now, because
Ubuntu/Debian packages do not install the policy files into the config
directory.

Change-Id: I6870052ff2c10a8d169f91af0559b8178dcd62ed

commit_message:
Exclude projects under the distributed leadership model

Currently there are 2 leadership types "distributed" and the
Default/unspecified which we treat as the long established PTL model.
Projects that have selected to use the "distributed" model do not
require a PTL election and in fact projects under this model should
reject a PTL nomination as the correct process involves a change the
governance repo.

This change updates 'create-directories' to exclude those projects,
and also updates the ci checks to fail PTL nominations for "distributed"
projects.

Change-Id: Ib4a2ce1e4ee74e8e9a49975017e14172b4d1f576

commit_message:
Correct two mistakes in the /continue_inspection API

* Correct the policy name for /continue_inspection ("node" vs "driver")
* Use the right version constant (83 was used before a rebase).

Also add missing unit tests (that would have found the issues).

Change-Id: Ib3eee48eb3ca4a52bfc6ec70491b01636516d6a9

commit_message:
Fix test_pool sorted list assertion failures

Some of the tests expect to be able to sort on the pool NS record priority. However, the rand_ns_records fake data generator can create NS records with equal priority which leads to undefined sort orders and ultimately invalid test failures.[2]
This patch makes sure the fake ns records created for tests never have equal priority values.

[2] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/69325d93f36042f390b4301cfadd3aa8/log/job-output.txt#21738

Change-Id: Ic04d1fe093dee54da64ccb238e9650ad5fc47eb8

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Restore python_requires after a typo

The "python_equires" typo was introduced by the change
I3980fbc53ce4b954aff5e98087897ea94e50e4fc, commit
a1e209c9a1bbee28c71ada7cc4675710f3b91794.

The typo apparently had a weird effect of declaring our
package as supporting Python 2, although obviously we
quit py2 long time ago.

Closes-bug: 1999431
Change-Id: Ife08f751bd64f2bbb04747ccc030d38ce78db712

commit_message:
Neutron&Designate integration - scenario test case

Test name: 'test_fip_is_published_with_associated_port'
This test case automates: "use-case-1" scenario:
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/yoga/admin/config-dns-int-ext
-serv.html#use-case-1-floating-ips-are-published-with-associated
-port-dns-attributes
Note: tests in "NeutronDesignateIntegration" class are DISABLED by default.
To enable, add the following section into the tempest.conf:
  [advanced_tempest_tests]
  neutron_designate_integration = True

Change-Id: I8e40749f42232488584397ab30e4204e9b7c2615
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin refs/changes/56/816356/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2021 Red Hat. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_log import log as logging from tempest import config from tempest.common import waiters as tempest_waiters from tempest.lib.common.utils import data_utils from tempest.lib.common.utils import test_utils from tempest.lib import decorators from tempest.api.compute import base as compute_base from tempest.api.network import base as network_base from designate_tempest_plugin.common import constants as const from designate_tempest_plugin.tests import base from designate_tempest_plugin.common import waiters CONF = config.CONF LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class ServerTest(base.BaseDnsV2Test, compute_base.BaseV2ComputeTest, network_base.BaseNetworkTest): credentials = ["admin", "primary"] @classmethod def setup_credentials(cls): cls.set_network_resources() super(ServerTest, cls).setup_credentials() @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super(ServerTest, cls).setup_clients() cls.zone_client = cls.os_admin.dns_v2.ZonesClient() cls.floating_ips_client = cls.os_admin.floating_ips_client cls.recordset_client = cls.os_admin.dns_v2.RecordsetClient() cls.servers_client = cls.os_admin.servers_client cls.ports_client = cls.os_admin.ports_client @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(ServerTest, cls).resource_setup() cls.zone = cls.zone_client.create_zone()[1] waiters.wait_for_zone_status( cls.zone_client, cls.zone['id'], const.ACTIVE) cls.secgroup = cls.security_groups_client.create_security_group( name=data_utils.rand_name('security_group_'), description=data_utils.rand_name( 'security_group_'))['security_group'] network_body = {'name': data_utils.rand_name('network_'), 'dns_domain': cls.zone['name']} cls.network = cls.networks_client.create_network( **network_body)['network'] cls.subnet = cls.subnets_client.create_subnet( network_id=cls.network['id'], ip_version=4, cidr='10.1.1.0/24',)['subnet'] cls.router = cls.routers_client.create_router( name=data_utils.rand_name('router_'), external_gateway_info={ 'network_id': CONF.network.public_network_id})['router'] cls.routers_client.add_router_interface( cls.router['id'], subnet_id=cls.subnet['id']) @decorators.idempotent_id('76bf9be2-3b22-11ec-a251-a12a2f51463d') def test_create_server_check_recordset_A(self): port = self.ports_client.create_port( network_id=self.network['id'], name=data_utils.rand_name('test_port_'))['port'] self.addCleanup(test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, self.ports_client.delete_port, port['id']) fip = self.floating_ips_client.create_floatingip( floating_network_id=CONF.network.public_network_id, port_id=port['id'])['floatingip'] self.addCleanup(test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, self.floating_ips_client.delete_floatingip, fip['id']) vm = self.servers_client.create_server( name=data_utils.rand_name('VM1_Server_'), flavorRef=CONF.compute.flavor_ref, imageRef=CONF.compute.image_ref, networks=[{'port': port['id']}])['server'] self.addCleanup(test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, self.servers_client.delete_server, vm['id']) tempest_waiters.wait_for_server_status( self.servers_client, vm['id'], const.ACTIVE) # List recordsets across all zones" recordsets = self.recordset_client.list_zones_recordsets() LOG.info('List recordsets across all zones: '.format(recordsets)) # List recordsets for a zone recordsets = self.recordset_client.list_recordset(self.zone['id'])[1] LOG.info('List recordsets for a zone: '.format(recordsets)) # List recordsets for all projects recordsets = self.recordset_client.list_owned_recordsets( headers=self.all_projects_header) LOG.info('List recordsets for all projects: '.format(recordsets))

commit_message:
Fix for "Update network" form

Currently, network update form sends value for "shared" field even if it
wasn't updated. Due to issue in Neutron, it checks
"rule:update_network:shared" policy, leading to false 403 error.
Patch fixes such behavior, sending "shared" flag only if it was changed
by form

Closes-Bug: #2029141
Change-Id: Ib1174a01021339f9aff04c170bb877b64d33bbfa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/45/890145/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Revert "pcmk_remote FFU support for Instance HA"

This reverts commit 2f460accb9800b2232c7cf783907b78bb94d98ef.

Upgrades from Train to Wallaby do not need the special authkey
treatment, so let's remove it.

Change-Id: Ic9caf9cc3f3bd687bc7fb29b4594da2c690aeff4

subject: Add libaio engine for fio on Centos/Rhel9
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-06-21 16:54:49.000000000', 'files': ['dib/burn-in/package-installs.yaml', 'dib/extra-hardware/package-installs.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent-builder/commit/0511bb337af51422a552a1cf4f2d6b1eef434d1c', 'message': "Add libaio engine for fio on Centos/Rhel9

fio packaging previously contained everything in one RPM,
but at some point for EL9 builds, this was split into multiple
RPMs where each engine used was put into it's own RPM.

In order for integrated disk benchmarking to work with
introspection, we use python-hardware. Python-hardware uses
fio, with libaio as a default option.

So now, we will attempt to install the other package which
should make users of the feature happier as their ramdisk
images will come with the contents required to do a benchmark
upfront.

Change-Id: I2028ac1cf350d86903a33e4bd91c209887de1e5c
(cherry picked from commit 1c1b8cf663598a74ee9391023e7b376f2dc6ea5a)
"}]
commit_message:
Add libaio engine for fio on Centos/Rhel9

fio packaging previously contained everything in one RPM,
but at some point for EL9 builds, this was split into multiple
RPMs where each engine used was put into it's own RPM.

In order for integrated disk benchmarking to work with
introspection, we use python-hardware. Python-hardware uses
fio, with libaio as a default option.

So now, we will attempt to install the other package which
should make users of the feature happier as their ramdisk
images will come with the contents required to do a benchmark
upfront.

Change-Id: I2028ac1cf350d86903a33e4bd91c209887de1e5c
(cherry picked from commit 1c1b8cf663598a74ee9391023e7b376f2dc6ea5a)

This patch caps virtualenv to <20.24.0 to fix stable/victoria's gate,
and also caps tox for the 'inner' virtualenv, otherwise tox>4 would be

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap virtualenv/setuptools

With latest virtualenv release (20.24.0) and its bundled setuptools
version, stable/victoria gates started to fail [1], because setuptools
is not compatible with the pbr version (5.5.0) which is in victoria
branch's upper constraint [2]. pbr's next release (5.5.1) removed the
failing code, this is why the change is only needed in stable/victoria.

This patch caps virtualenv to <20.24.0 to fix stable/victoria's gate,
and also caps tox for the 'inner' virtualenv, otherwise tox>4 would be
installed, that would introduce failures (those failures are fixed in
newer stable branches, but it would need several backports and 'outer'
tox is capped <4 anyway, so no worth dealing with it here).

[1] AttributeError: module 'setuptools.command.easy_install' has no attribute 'get_script_header'
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/src/commit/636b6b3bde4b68ef27ac6b524cb888152eddf517/upper-constraints.txt#L44

Change-Id: I56a205a5755bfe9838ea209b79bf7abe3ba96858
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/01/888701/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Cap setuptools via virtualenv to prevent compatibility issue with victoria # branch's upper constraint of pbr package (5.5.0). Tox is also needed to be # constrained for the 'inner' tox to be installed with the constrained venv. requires = virtualenv<20.24.0 tox<4

subject: Fix failed count for anti-affinity check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-06-06 08:22:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/test_server_group.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/exception.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/build_results.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1b56714e9119ab4152e6f33985a499b2d83a491b', 'message': 'Fix failed count for anti-affinity check

The late anti-affinity check runs in the compute manager to avoid
parallel scheduling requests to invalidate the anti-affinity server
group policy. When the check fails the instance is re-scheduled.
However this failure counted as a real instance boot failure of the
compute host and can lead to de-prioritization of the compute host
in the scheduler via BuildFailureWeigher. As the late anti-affinity
check does not indicate any fault of the compute host itself it
should not be counted towards the build failure counter.
This patch adds new build results to handle this case.

Closes-Bug: #1996732
Change-Id: I2ba035c09ace20e9835d9d12a5c5bee17d616718
Signed-off-by: Yusuke Okada <okada.yusuke@fujitsu.com>
(cherry picked from commit 56d320a203a13f262a2e94e491af222032e453d3)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix failed count for anti-affinity check

The late anti-affinity check runs in the compute manager to avoid
parallel scheduling requests to invalidate the anti-affinity server
group policy. When the check fails the instance is re-scheduled.
However this failure counted as a real instance boot failure of the
compute host and can lead to de-prioritization of the compute host
in the scheduler via BuildFailureWeigher. As the late anti-affinity
check does not indicate any fault of the compute host itself it
should not be counted towards the build failure counter.
This patch adds new build results to handle this case.

Closes-Bug: #1996732
Change-Id: I2ba035c09ace20e9835d9d12a5c5bee17d616718
Signed-off-by: Yusuke Okada <okada.yusuke@fujitsu.com>
(cherry picked from commit 56d320a203a13f262a2e94e491af222032e453d3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/43/885343/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Instance failed by policy violation (such as affinity or anti-affinity) # and was not rescheduled. In this case, the node's failed count won't be # increased. FAILED_BY_POLICY = 'failed_by_policy' # Instance failed by policy violation (such as affinity or anti-affinity) # but was rescheduled. In this case, the node's failed count won't be # increased. RESCHEDULED_BY_POLICY = 'rescheduled_by_policy'

commit_message:
Reduce number of PGs

to avoid warning caused by too many pgs assigned to a single OSD.

The warning is seen in scenario 004 integration job because Rados
Gateway creates additional pools.

Change-Id: Ice01e0ea8313ae9732c0e48003f886fb85ecc9fd
(cherry picked from commit 9ab8f9a60f149269cd087bc921e7db9c6289e0ea)

commit_message:
rgw profile: Support keystone integration

This introduces a few new parameters to the profile class so that users
can enable keystone integration of RADOS Gateway.

This allows us to fix some ignored profile parameters, and also remove
the references from the non-profile manifest to the profile parameters.

The rgw_keystone_version parameter is removed by this change.
The actual parameter was deprecated[1] and was removed[2] from the rgw
class very long ago.

[1] 85b9d61c40430de32d311cea201a2a33ec91a6b8
[2] 0377da4e088ab88b97af1143191be8da39e1623b

Change-Id: I4026d3c2d40ae9b7ed9c3a60529011854b878f89
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/28/890028/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | The new ``ceph::profile::params::rgw_keystone_integration`` parameter has been added. This allows enabling Ceph RADOS Gateway integration with OpenStack Keystone. upgrade: - | The ``ceph::profile::params::rgw_keystone_version`` parameter has been removed.

Stop generating adminrc

We no longer need this file because now providers use the clouds.yaml
file instead.

commit_message:
Fix Share Networks dashboard

Patch adds some awareness of optional parameters at Share Networks
dashboard rendering. Currently, some of them are treated as required,
leading to page render fail

Change-Id: Iffd988a79f449fe36191e5219144ad99866a9c02

added_lines: def test_list_view(self): share_net_list = [test_data.active_share_network, test_data.active_share_network_without_neutron_id] self.mock_object(api_manila, "share_network_list", mock.Mock(return_value=share_net_list)) self.mock_object( api_neutron, "network_list", mock.Mock(return_value=self.networks.list())) self.mock_object( api_neutron, "subnet_list", mock.Mock(return_value=self.subnets.list())) url = INDEX_URL res = self.client.get(url) for net in share_net_list: self.assertContains(res, "%s" % net.name, 1, 200) self.assertNoMessages() api_manila.share_network_list.assert_called_once_with( mock.ANY, detailed=True, search_opts={'all_tenants': True}) api_neutron.network_list.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY) api_neutron.subnet_list.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY)

commit_message:
Remove `Member` role

In OpenStack deployment we more commonly use `member` than `Member`.
Also the `member` role is now implied by the `admin` role.

This removes the Member role to get rid of the unused role and follow
the standard roles.

Change-Id: I64175a3d485358af9a012060826dcedbe24b1042
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/25/890025/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix ineffective rgw_service parameter

... and introduces a few new parameters to customize keystone service,
so that we can replace it by the generic interfaces.

Closes-Bug: #2029009
Change-Id: Ia91560a0948257c7a7801aaca9f43bfde2a573fb

commit_message:
Fix missing modificationsTriggeredByVnfPkgChange

This patch fixes the following problems.
* Fix the problem that modificationsTriggeredByVnfPkgChange is not
  included in VnfLcmOpOcc when the change_vnfpkg v2 API is executed
  finished in COMPLETED.
* According to SOL002 specification, vnfcInfo id should be unique
  in the VNFs. Currently there is no check uniqueness of vnfcInfo id
  when user sets metadata['VDU_VNFc_mapping'], so implement uniqueness
  and format checks when VnfInstance creation and Modify VNF
  Information operation.
* Fix to keep the current VnfInstance "vnfConfigurableProperties",
  "extensions", and "metadata" when vnfdId is changed in
  Modify VNF Information.
  This is according to specification of change_vnfpkg v2 API.

Closes-Bug: #2015941
Closes-Bug: #2015944
Change-Id: I12e9e432468fe3dd1e7ef5abdcd5cd7688dcf2a0

commit_message:
Add additional ramdisk tests

Noticed we're missing some test coverage in regards to booting from
ramdisks when I was investigating an issue which was reported against
wallaby.

Adds tests which *should* catch the issue I'm chasing in wallaby.

Change-Id: I4965d0cc3966c50fa0485b5e194248dd2072f7a8
(cherry picked from commit e851d63464597f8825d4c14c0e632d39b82dbc4d)

commit_message:
Drop python2 from bindep.txt

IPA dropped support for Python2 long ago,
and now Python2 is not even available in newer distros,
breaking installation if IPA binary dependencies.

Change-Id: I75a618f94de58f6de2bd96b37de1894bb0e61998
(cherry picked from commit d8a6bf5f61eb1365294c6c07840286f46c9535fc)
(cherry picked from commit 57f1e5309ee90209611d0db0b71b7b1842b7043f)

subject: Fix Cinder Integration fallout from CVE-2023-2088
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-06-02 07:47:03.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/common/keystone.py', 'devstack/lib/ironic', 'ironic/common/cinder.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/common/test_cinder.py', 'releasenotes/notes/cinder-2019892-6b5a9de5c5f05aa6.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/5375d2797a098ab4b62dcc335de9b6c9ba914ce8', 'message': 'Fix Cinder Integration fallout from CVE-2023-2088

In the recent change to cinder, to address CVE-2023-2088,
cinder changed the policy rules and behavior for unbinding,
or "detaching" a volume. This was because of a vulnerability
in compute nodes where a volume which was in use by a VM
could be detached outside of Nova, and nova wouldn't become
aware the volume was detached, and the volume could be accessible
to the next VM.

This vulnerability doesn't apply to bare metal operations as
volumes are attached to whole baremetal nodes with Ironic.

We now generate and use a service token when interacting with
Cinder which allows cinder to recognize "this request is
coming from a fellow OpenStack service", and by-pass
checking with Nova if the "instance" is managed by Nova,
or Not. This allows the volumes to be attached, and detached
as needed as part of the power operation flow and overall
set of lifecycle operations.

Related-Bug: 2004555
Closes-Bug: 2019892

Change-Id: Ib258bc9650496da989fc93b759b112d279c8b217
(cherry picked from commit 9c0b4c90a19fc1db262a942a1b6a1baafc881ccc)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Cinder Integration fallout from CVE-2023-2088

In the recent change to cinder, to address CVE-2023-2088,
cinder changed the policy rules and behavior for unbinding,
or "detaching" a volume. This was because of a vulnerability
in compute nodes where a volume which was in use by a VM
could be detached outside of Nova, and nova wouldn't become
aware the volume was detached, and the volume could be accessible
to the next VM.

This vulnerability doesn't apply to bare metal operations as
volumes are attached to whole baremetal nodes with Ironic.

We now generate and use a service token when interacting with
Cinder which allows cinder to recognize "this request is
coming from a fellow OpenStack service", and by-pass
checking with Nova if the "instance" is managed by Nova,
or Not. This allows the volumes to be attached, and detached
as needed as part of the power operation flow and overall
set of lifecycle operations.

Related-Bug: 2004555
Closes-Bug: 2019892

Change-Id: Ib258bc9650496da989fc93b759b112d279c8b217
(cherry picked from commit 9c0b4c90a19fc1db262a942a1b6a1baafc881ccc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/18/885018/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes Ironic integration with Cinder because of changes which resulted as part of the recent Security related fix in `bug 2004555 <https://launchpad.net/bugs/2004555>`_. The work in Ironic to track this fix was logged in `bug 2019892 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/2019892>`_. Ironic now sends a service token to Cinder, which allows for access restrictions added as part of the original CVE-2023-2088 fix to be appropriately bypassed. Ironic was not vulnerable, but the restrictions added as a result did impact Ironic's usage. This is because Ironic volume attachments are not on a shared "compute node", but instead mapped to the physical machines and Ironic handles the attachment life-cycle after initial attachment.

subject: Clean out agent token even if power is already off
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-15 08:34:24.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_utils.py', 'ironic/conductor/utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-power-off-token-wipe-e7d605997f00d39d.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/149f36f96cbe3c5220137d0681f830e368b8743e', 'message': 'Clean out agent token even if power is already off

While investigating a very curious report, I discovered that
if somehow the power was *already* turned off to a node, say
through an incorrect BMC *or* human action, and Ironic were
to pick it up (as it does by default, because it checks before
applying the power state, then it would not wipe the token
information, preventing the agent from connecting on the next
action/attempt/operation.

We now remove the token on all calls to conductor
utilities node_power_action method when appropriate, even
if no other work is required.

Change-Id: Ie89e8be9ad2887467f277772445d4bef79fa5ea1
(cherry picked from commit bcf6c12269168c5b4f0d9d4d3212e813f1827494)
'}]
commit_message:
Clean out agent token even if power is already off

While investigating a very curious report, I discovered that
if somehow the power was *already* turned off to a node, say
through an incorrect BMC *or* human action, and Ironic were
to pick it up (as it does by default, because it checks before
applying the power state, then it would not wipe the token
information, preventing the agent from connecting on the next
action/attempt/operation.

We now remove the token on all calls to conductor
utilities node_power_action method when appropriate, even
if no other work is required.

Change-Id: Ie89e8be9ad2887467f277772445d4bef79fa5ea1
(cherry picked from commit bcf6c12269168c5b4f0d9d4d3212e813f1827494)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/08/877408/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes an issue where an agent token could be inadvertently orphaned if a node is already in the target power state when we attempt to turn the node off.

subject: Wipe Agent Token when cleaning timeout occcurs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-15 08:31:30.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_utils.py', 'ironic/conductor/utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/wipe-agent-token-upon-cleaning-timeout-c9add514fad1b02c.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/9e460f9c67ce55c38733405690d7135448f798c0', 'message': 'Wipe Agent Token when cleaning timeout occcurs

In a relatively odd turn of events, should cleaning
have started, but then timed out due to lost communications
or a hard failure of the machine, an agent token could
previously be orphaned preventing re-cleaning.

We now explicitly remove the token in this case.

Change-Id: I236cdf6ddb040284e9fd1fa10136ad17ef665638
(cherry picked from commit 47b5909486c336352c536eb2cadd121afea8cf12)
'}]
commit_message:
Wipe Agent Token when cleaning timeout occcurs

In a relatively odd turn of events, should cleaning
have started, but then timed out due to lost communications
or a hard failure of the machine, an agent token could
previously be orphaned preventing re-cleaning.

We now explicitly remove the token in this case.

Change-Id: I236cdf6ddb040284e9fd1fa10136ad17ef665638
(cherry picked from commit 47b5909486c336352c536eb2cadd121afea8cf12)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/03/877403/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes an issue where an agent token was being orphaned if a baremetal node timed out during cleaning operations, leading to issues where the node would not be able to establish a new token with Ironic upon future in some cases. We now always wipe the token in this case.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-15 08:34:13.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_utils.py', 'ironic/conductor/utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-power-off-token-wipe-e7d605997f00d39d.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/d40f6067de2f4c726c5f73b764ef2bacd1692b2c', 'message': 'Clean out agent token even if power is already off

Change-Id: Ie89e8be9ad2887467f277772445d4bef79fa5ea1

commit_message:
Clean out agent token even if power is already off

While investigating a very curious report, I discovered that
if somehow the power was *already* turned off to a node, say
through an incorrect BMC *or* human action, and Ironic were
to pick it up (as it does by default, because it checks before
applying the power state, then it would not wipe the token
information, preventing the agent from connecting on the next
action/attempt/operation.

We now remove the token on all calls to conductor
utilities node_power_action method when appropriate, even
if no other work is required.

Change-Id: Ie89e8be9ad2887467f277772445d4bef79fa5ea1
(cherry picked from commit bcf6c12269168c5b4f0d9d4d3212e813f1827494)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/07/877407/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes an issue where an agent token could be inadvertently orphaned if a node is already in the target power state when we attempt to turn the node off.

commit_message:
Fix the fluentd regexp to collect the logs

The default value of logging_context_format_string and
logging_user_identity_format has changed [1][2][3].
This is to correct fluentd to use the same format.

[1]https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log/commit/ebdee7f39920ad5b4268ee296952432b0d41a375
[2]https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log/commit/7ed065f38df0595881d07eb91cec9e5c07cb38be

[3]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.log/+/838185

Closes-Bug: #1872220
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/884815

commit_message:
replace validate_legacy with proper data types

the validate_legacy function is marked for deprecation in
v9.0.0 from puppetlabs-stdlib.

This also adds a few strict validations to the db classes based on
the validations implemented in the underlying resources.

Change-Id: I9e809415a532a694a50492a5600863d7d3d18a20

commit_message:
Remove Glance and Neutron TLS proxies from fluentd input config

Those logs are haproxy logs which are pushed through fluentd
syslog input (just like ,,normal'' haproxy logs) and we don't
parse them at all.

Closes-Bug: #2029128
Change-Id: Ic2529e905ebbec6180179b89568f9bd5a0581035

commit_message:
Fixed assignment of `isAutomaticInvocation` in lcmocc

When LCM is executed automatically, set `isAutomaticInvocation` in
VnfLcmOpOccV2 to True.

commit_message:
Enforce quota usage from placement when unshelving

When [quota]count_usage_from_placement = true or
[quota]driver = nova.quota.UnifiedLimitsDriver, cores and ram quota
usage are counted from placement. When an instance is SHELVED_OFFLOADED,
it will not have allocations in placement, so its cores and ram should
not count against quota during that time.

This means however that when an instance is unshelved, there is a
possibility of going over quota if the cores and ram it needs were
allocated by some other instance(s) while it was SHELVED_OFFLOADED.

This fixes a bug where quota was not being properly enforced during
unshelve of a SHELVED_OFFLOADED instance when quota usage is counted
from placement. Test coverage is also added for the "recheck" quota
cases.

Closes-Bug: #2003991

Change-Id: I4ab97626c10052c7af9934a80ff8db9ddab82738
(cherry picked from commit 6f79d6321e7c3edaab2eb911198b7b7f851371b3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/92/888092/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.limit import utils as limit_utils @staticmethod def _check_quota_unshelve_offloaded( context: nova_context.RequestContext, instance: 'objects.Instance', request_spec: 'objects.RequestSpec' ): if not (CONF.quota.count_usage_from_placement or limit_utils.use_unified_limits()): return # TODO(melwitt): This is ugly but we have to do it this way because # instances quota is currently counted from the API database but cores # and ram are counted from placement. That means while an instance is # SHELVED_OFFLOADED, it will still consume instances quota but it will # not consume cores and ram. So we need an instances delta of # 0 but cores and ram deltas from the flavor. # Once instances usage is also being counted from placement, we can # replace this method with a normal check_num_instances_quota() call. vcpus = instance.flavor.vcpus memory_mb = instance.flavor.memory_mb # We are not looking to create a new server, we are unshelving an # existing one. deltas = {'instances': 0, 'cores': vcpus, 'ram': memory_mb} objects.Quotas.check_deltas( context, deltas, context.project_id, user_id=context.user_id, check_project_id=instance.project_id, check_user_id=instance.user_id, ) # Do the same for unified limits. placement_limits.enforce_num_instances_and_flavor( context, context.project_id, instance.flavor, request_spec.is_bfv, 0, 0, delta_updates={'servers': 0}) # Check quota before we save any changes to the database, but only if # we are counting quota usage from placement. When an instance is # SHELVED_OFFLOADED, it will not consume cores or ram resources in # placement. This means it is possible that an unshelve would cause the # project/user to go over quota. if instance.vm_state == vm_states.SHELVED_OFFLOADED: self._check_quota_unshelve_offloaded( context, instance, request_spec)

commit_message:
Fix tox.ini

Change [1] modified the tox.ini file in a way that it builds now
a regular Python package and installs it into virtual environment
instead of using the editable module. The current configuration
also breaks the behavior under tox version 3, where skipsdist option
could be set only on top level of tox.ini file.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/+/868072

Change-Id: I0bc8c30d58cc12c15cf657f2699f40641174c63c
(cherry picked from commit fd5d5818e388d0357619be3090d5b6fe2029834f)

commit_message:
Add the admin role for admin in default domain

Add the admin role for admin in default domain as in some cases,
we might have an admin user in another domain and this seems to
confused ansible ... or perhaps the issue with with the user
management plugin in ansible which can't select the proper admin
user if we have 2 (or more) different admin users located in
different projects.

Change-Id: If3707a7a53749cafd4a867a19cc7666e2ef5893b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-26 15:40:23.000000000', 'files': ['plugins/module_utils/openstack.py', 'changelogs/fragments/remove-default-for-interface.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack/commit/1c3ed00f1963c6a84e2f620259c549c1f0652927', 'message': 'Remove default value for interface

Since a default value for interface parameter is defined and provided
for the connection, if interface is defined in clouds.yaml it would
be ignored.

At the same time it is only interface parameter that behaves in this way
all other params that are defined in clouds.yaml will be respected.

With that, default value for interface is already defined in SDK, so

Change-Id: I129b1660a14a287c53173eec9f6e7bad84efc735
'}]
commit_message:
Remove default value for interface

Since a default value for interface parameter is defined and provided
for the connection, if interface is defined in clouds.yaml it would
be ignored.

At the same time it is only interface parameter that behaves in this way
all other params that are defined in clouds.yaml will be respected.

With that, default value for interface is already defined in SDK, so
it is not required to have default in module and removing it does not
change behaviour.

Change-Id: I129b1660a14a287c53173eec9f6e7bad84efc735
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack refs/changes/29/889729/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- minor_changes: - All modules do not have default `interface` (`endpoint_type`) set. Default value is handled by openstacksdk directly. Public endpoint will still be used if parameter is not provided to modules. bugfixes: - In case `interface` (`endpoint_type`) is defined in clouds.yaml it will be respected. When same parameter is defined for the module it will have prescedence over one in clouds.yaml.

commit_message:
Add the initial skeleton of the agent inspect interface

No real inspection is done: it only accepts data and returns success.

Common code has been extracted from the existing inspector-based
implementation.

Change-Id: I7462bb2e0449fb1098fe59e394b5c583fea89bac

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-20 08:22:26.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/770352beb05f63fb9192ad488b6b8344fd57c985', 'message': 'git: git checkout for a commit hash combinated with depth argument

This patch: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/882299
provides functionality, that commit hash can be passed as last arugment,
however when GIT_DEPTH is set, it fails, as in:

--depth 1 --branch 03b95a4566a15f7544f4cdf35629dacede4dcf55

not found in upstream origin

Closes-Bug: #2023020
Change-Id: I748354964a133e028e12458cc9014d6d014cbdb9
'}]
commit_message:
git: git checkout for a commit hash combinated with depth argument

This patch: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/882299
provides functionality, that commit hash can be passed as last arugment,
however when GIT_DEPTH is set, it fails, as in:

timeout -s SIGINT 0 git clone https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn.git ./ovn
--depth 1 --branch 03b95a4566a15f7544f4cdf35629dacede4dcf55
fatal: Remote branch 03b95a4566a15f7544f4cdf35629dacede4dcf55
not found in upstream origin

Closes-Bug: #2023020
Change-Id: I748354964a133e028e12458cc9014d6d014cbdb9

subject: DNM: Verify whether we persist some wrong ReqSpec values
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-27 08:54:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_2XXXXXX.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f06374dd930e82ba0efe7298b8b08d11b94d14af', 'message': "DNM: Verify whether we persist some wrong ReqSpec values

When we rebuild, we modify the RequestSpec to provide some fields [1] before
calling the conductor and then the scheduler so the latter can know whether
it needs to only verify the existing host for a rebuild or not.
That being said, those fields shouldn't be persisted or later move operations
for the same instance could be checked by the scheduler like a rebuild.

This scenario just verifies for both standard instance and volume-backed ones
that eventually we don't persist those fields (YaY!).

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/commit/e5ee5e035c0c85654a139131d51be5c4df76f400/nova/compute/api.py#L3772-L3793

Change-Id: Iffc2d2f0a561faf546d72d7149e12a4d46828fc1
"}]
commit_message:
DNM: Verify whether we persist some wrong ReqSpec values

When we rebuild, we modify the RequestSpec to provide some fields [1] before
calling the conductor and then the scheduler so the latter can know whether
it needs to only verify the existing host for a rebuild or not.
That being said, those fields shouldn't be persisted or later move operations
for the same instance could be checked by the scheduler like a rebuild.

This scenario just verifies for both standard instance and volume-backed ones
that eventually we don't persist those fields (YaY!).

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/commit/e5ee5e035c0c85654a139131d51be5c4df76f400/nova/compute/api.py#L3772-L3793

Change-Id: Iffc2d2f0a561faf546d72d7149e12a4d46828fc1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/43/889843/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from unittest import mock from nova import context from nova import objects from nova.tests.functional import integrated_helpers class RebuildPersistingTestCase(integrated_helpers._IntegratedTestBase): """Regression test for bug 2xxxxxx. This tests a rebuild scenario for verifying whether we persist some fields. """ api_major_version = 'v2.1' microversion = 'latest' def test_rebuild_standard_instance(self): server = self._create_server(networks='auto') # Rebuild a server server = self._rebuild_server(server, image_uuid=self.glance.image2['id']) self.assertEqual(self.glance.image2['id'], server['image']['id']) self._wait_for_state_change(server, 'ACTIVE') # Verify that we don't persist the RequestSpec fields for rebuild ctxt = context.get_admin_context() spec_obj = objects.RequestSpec.get_by_instance_uuid(ctxt, server['id']) self.assertEqual({}, spec_obj.scheduler_hints) self.assertIsNone(spec_obj.force_hosts) self.assertIsNone(spec_obj.force_nodes) def test_rebuild_bfv_instance(self): self.flags(cross_az_attach=True, group='cinder') # Do not need imageRef for boot from volume. server = self._build_server(image_uuid='', networks='auto') server['block_device_mapping_v2'] = [{ 'source_type': 'volume', 'destination_type': 'volume', 'boot_index': 0, 'uuid': self.cinder.IMAGE_BACKED_VOL }] server = self.api.post_server({'server': server}) server = self._wait_for_state_change(server, 'ACTIVE') # Rebuild a server # FIXME(sbauza): Instead of mocking here the instance_event call, the # CinderFixture should support it. with mock.patch.object(self.compute.manager.virtapi, 'wait_for_instance_event'): server = self._rebuild_server( server, image_uuid=self.glance.image2['id']) self._wait_for_state_change(server, 'ACTIVE') # Verify that we don't persist the RequestSpec fields for rebuild ctxt = context.get_admin_context() spec_obj = objects.RequestSpec.get_by_instance_uuid(ctxt, server['id']) self.assertEqual({}, spec_obj.scheduler_hints) self.assertIsNone(spec_obj.force_hosts) self.assertIsNone(spec_obj.force_nodes)
